children.value: An avatar will be used to display a visual identifier for an individual user.

<Canvas>
  <Story
    name="Avatar"
    args={{
      imageUrl:
        "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1533858539156-90ea20bafd17?ixid=MXwxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHw%3D&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1650&q=80",
      name: "The Jobbler",
      size: "large",
      initials: "JBLR",
      color: "var(--color-indigo)",
    }}
  >
    {args => <Avatar {...args} />}
  </Story>
</Canvas>
: Use when the avatar is the focal point.
: Use on higher-density/compact pages or components.
If an avatar is displayed without a name label, display a tooltip.

Initials and background color should have sufficient color contrast to meet
AA.
with an Avatar is currently not used in Jobber.

to indicate the background and the border color of an avatar
component.

, make sure that the color is consistent for a user throughout
the application. The color that is represented for an avatar should be the same
color that represents a user in other parts of the application, such as the
calendar.

setColor(e.target.value)} />
); }}
If an avatar is displayed without a name label, display a tooltip.
